paper.title: Finite H-dimension does not imply expressive completeness

author.org: Department of Computing, Imperial College London, England#TAB#

paper.publisher: Springer Science and Business Media LLC
paper.abstract: A conjecture of Gabbay (1981) states that any class of flows of time having the property known as finite H-dimension admits a finite set of expressively complete one-dimensional temporal connectives. Here we show that the class of ‘circular’ structures refutes the generalisation of this conjecture to Kripke frames. We then construct from this class, by a general method, a new class of irreflexive transitive flows of time that refutes the original conjecture.
